snippet: Dreamcatcher Repertory Theater of South Orange will present its spring readings at the Oakes Center in Summit on May 16 and 23.
abstract: Dreamcatcher Repertory Theater of South Orange will present spring readings of plays by company members at the Oakes Center in Summit, the company's future home; readings are scheduled to take place on May 16 and 23 (Metropolitan/New Jersey). Photo (M).
lead_paragraph: THIS spring's play readings by the Dreamcatcher Repertory Theater of South Orange, to take place May 16 and 23, will look slightly different from the way they usually do. In addition to hearing two new plays read by company members, audience members will have a chance to preview the nonprofit theater's future home: the Oakes Center in Summit. For the past few years, the company, whose current home is the Baird Center in South Orange, has held the spring readings at Reeves-Reed Arboretum, also in Summit, said Laura Ekstrand, Dreamcatcher's artistic director. ''But this year,'' she said, ''we wanted to let people get a look at where we're going.''

headline.main: Spring's Plays Offer Peek at New Home
